creator: albino.vico@nrm.qld.gov.au
text:
It appears that variables are only substituted if mentioned at the start of a 
regular expression
I am using a CSV Data Set config. eg to represent
${var1}=myNumber

Example:
Regular Expression = "BlahBlah${var1}=([0-9]+)"
appears to search for BlahBlah${var1}=([0-9]+) instead of
BlahBlahmyNumber=([0-9]+)

But 
Regular Expression = "${var1}=([0-9]+)"
appears to search for myNumber=([0-9]+)

(Apologies if you aware, this is the first time I have logged a but, but am 
keen.  I always test my regular expressions, and have been using Jmeter for 4 
mths.  )
Bug also mentioned here.
http://mail-archives.apache.org/mod_mbox/jakarta-jmeter-user/200407.mbox/%
3C20040723102440.89965.qmail@web11902.mail.yahoo.com%3E

Might be worth trying with temporary variable:

i.e. Define RE = BlahBlah${var1}=([0-9]+)

Does that work OK?

Otherwise, perhaps there is something in BlahBlah that is causing problems for 
the variable replacer.
creator: sebb@apache.org

text:
Apologies, After more testing I realised I made an error in the regular 
expression and it was evaluating the variable.  
The Regular Expression does evaluate the variable.
creator: albino.vico@nrm.qld.gov.au
